questions.question_text: Which platform uses Cyber Threat Intelligence as its main source of information?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Cisco Secure Endpoint (Formerly known as AMP) utilizes threat intelligence:
AMP solutions actively consume and analyze threat intelligence feeds to identify known malicious files and behaviors, allowing them to proactively block threats based on the latest threat information.

Selected Answer: B
Based on devnet-3223.pdf, the script imports a domain for checking and adding to the block list. So B could be correct.

comments.content: eventType is missing from json data (may be blocked, allowed, detected) - so we dont know exactly..

choices.C: editing malicious domains in Cisco Umbrella Enforcement that have changed status
choices.A: importing malicious domains to Cisco Umbrella Enforcement for additional processing
choices.D: editing malicious domains in Cisco Umbrella Enforcement that have changed IP address
choices.B: importing malicious domains to Cisco Umbrella Enforcement for blocking

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which task is the Python script performing by using the Umbrella Enforcement API?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Brute-force attacks can take place offline or online. In case of an offline attack, the attacker has access to the encrypted material or a password hash and tries different key without the risk of discovery or interference
The primary purpose of salt is to defend against dictionary attacks and precomputed rainbow table attacks, which are techniques used to reverse cryptographic hashes and discover the original input

MFA and captcha would be methods of online prevention, and salt (altering the hash of a password) for offline prevention. However, salt only makes it more difficult to succeed with the attack, but does not prevent it.

questions.question_text: Which security mechanism is designed to protect against “offline brute-force” attacks?
What is the default action before identifying the URL during HTTPS inspection in Cisco Secure Firewall Threat Defense software?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
It is pass, otherwise it will not be sent to the IPS.

Selected Answer: D
For some features, including URL filtering, application detection, rate limiting, and Intelligent Application Bypass, a few packets must pass in order for the connection to be established, and to enable the system to identify the traffic and determine which access control rule (if any) will handle that traffic.
https://docs.defenseorchestrator.com/cdfmc/r_best_practices_for_url_filtering.html#!c_the_default_intrusion_policy_2.html#ID-2194-0000001f

Selected Answer: D
Before identifying the URL during HTTPS inspection in Cisco Secure Firewall Threat Defense software, the default action is to 'pass.' This means that the traffic is allowed through without inspection until the URL can be identified, at which point appropriate security policies can be applied based on the URL categorization and reputation.
For that I think the correct responce is D
I believe this may be D.

Selected Answer: A
To redirect traffic to a Cisco Secure Web Appliance (SWA) for URL inspection using a Cisco IOS router, you utilize the Web Cache Communication Protocol (WCCP).
